tetra.stats.source_leech.tooltip: Dealing damage with this weapon restores §d%s Mana§r.
tetra.stats.source_leech.tooltip_short: Dealing damage with this weapon restores §dMana§r.
tetra.stats.spellstrike.tooltip: Spellstriking weapons cast an inscribed spell on the target struck. Each level beyond the first adds 1 §6Amplify Glyph§r at the end of the spell!
tetra.stats.spellstrike.tooltip_short: Spellstriking weapons cast a spell on the target struck.
tetra.tooltips.inscribable: Can be inscribed with a §eformless§r spell at a §dScribe's Table§r.
tetra/schematic/shared/spellstrike_1.des: Etch careful engravings into your weapon, allowing it to deliver spells once inscribed in a §dScribe's Table§r.
tetra/schematic/shared/spellstrike_2.des: Etch further intricate patterns, adding 1 §6Amplify Glyph§r at the end of the inscribed spell.
tetra/schematic/shared/spellstrike_3.des: Etch most detailed patterns, adding 2 §6Amplify Glyphs§r at the end of the inscribed spell.
tetra.improvement.spellstrike.name: Spellstriking
ars_armiger.spellstrike.invalid: Your spell must not contain a Method!
ars_armiger.page.tetra_weapons.subtitle: Adding magic to the mundane
ars_armiger.page.tetra_weapons.page1.bod: You surmise you can use materials such as Source Gems, Archwood or Magebloom threads in the construction of modular weapons, imbuing the item with higher Magical Capacity and innate power in the form of Source Leech and Spellstriker. Use a Holosphere to see detailed statistics on these materials.
ars_armiger.page.tetra_weapons.page2.bod: (See weapon above to see available magical parts). Modular weapons made with magical parts gain the Source Leech ability, which restores the your Mana with each successful strike. The more parts with this ability, the more mana you regain.
ars_armiger.page.tetra_weapons.page3.bod: Melee modular weapons can be imbued with this Improvement. When Honing the weapon's major modules; You can further augment the level of this ability, Up to Spellstriker III. A Source Gem Socket will also increase this ability by 1 level, but never past Spellstriker III.
ars_armiger.page.tetra_weapons.page4.bod: Weapons with the Spellstriker ability will cast an inscribed spell on any struck targets or blocks (if thrown). For each Spellstriker level beyond the first, the inscribed spell gains 1 Amplify Glyph at the end of the spell. Spellstriking weapons can be inscribed at a Scribe's Table by a spell that must NOT contain a form glyph such as Ignite -> Extend Time.
